Submodules¶

ctqa.app module¶

CTQA App Module
Description: Main CTQA application file. Contains logic for preparing/starting execution.
ctqa.app.run(config, profiles, __DEBUG, weekly=False)[source]¶

Main function for preparing and running the CTQA audit.

ctqa.audit module¶

Audit Utility

A module that contains logic for running an audit, grouping images by series, and running homogeneity/linearity calculations.

ctqa.audit.auditImages(datasets)[source]¶

Retrieves audit method based off of the reader’s manufacturer and performs appropriate audits based on this.

Input, datasets, is expected to be a 2D array. The function loops through each element on the first level and executes the audits based on the contents of the second level array.

Expected Contents of Second Level Array:

[ MACHINE_NAME , MACHINE_PROFILE , MACHINE_QC_IMAGE ]

Please Note: MACHINE_QC_IMAGE is referring to a pydicom dicom object.

ctqa.audit.computeHomogeneity(audit, dataset)[source]¶

Attempts to rescale DICOM pixel data by the DICOM RescaleIntercept/Slope tags. After attempted rescale, a region is selected from the pixel data. Which region is dependant on the audit parameter. A 1D array of DICOM pixel data is returned.

ctqa.audit.deleteOldROISelections()[source]¶

Deletes any old ROI selection graphics

ctqa.audit.getAuditDatasets(series)[source]¶

Selects a specified slice from a series based off of a value in a reader’s profile

ctqa.audit.groupSeries(imgs)[source]¶

Function for grouping passed images by their series UID

ctqa.audit.performHomogeneityAudit(method, img)[source]¶

Prepares a spot in the global data variable (runs setupHomogeneityData) for data coming from the audits and runs each audit listed under the method parameter. The output of each method is stored under the StudyDate (DICOM tag).

ctqa.audit.reformROIArray(data, x1, x2)[source]¶

Loops through flat ROI array and turns into 2d ROI array

ctqa.audit.run(profiles, imgs, output_rois=True)[source]¶

Main function for running the audit.

ctqa.audit.scalePixelData(pixelData, rInt, rSlope)[source]¶

Scales pixel image values linearly by rescale values

ctqa.audit.selectArea(arr, x1, y1, x2, y2)[source]¶

Selects a specified area from a 2D array and fills a 1D arr with the values

ctqa.audit.setupHomogeneityData(method, img, date, reader)[source]¶

Prepares a spot in the global DATA variable for incoming audit data.

ctqa.auditmethods module¶

Audit Methods Module

A module that contains data regarding the audits available for a CT machine, sorted by manufacturer.

ctqa.auditmethods.getAuditDirections(manufacturer)[source]¶

The audit directions are gotten based off of the manufacturer string.

EX: [‘NORTH’, ‘SOUTH’, ‘EAST’, ‘WEST’, ‘CENTER’]

If no manufacturer is found for the passed string, the default is returned.

ctqa.auditmethods.getMethod(manufacturer)[source]¶

Gets audit methods by passed manufacturer string. Uses manufacturer string as a key to search the METHODS Dictionary object.

If no suitable manufacturer is found, the default audit methods are used.

ctqa.autoprofiles module¶

Auto Profiles Module

A module that contains logic for automatically identifying CT reader profiles from a linked database.

ctqa.autoprofiles.getSize()[source]¶

Gets size of all images from source

ctqa.autoprofiles.run()[source]¶

Loops through all images and attempts to find new profiles.

ctqa.confutil module¶

CTQA Config Utility

Utility for creating/saving/loading/updating a JSON configuration file.

ctqa.confutil.checkForNewKeys(conf, path)[source]¶

Updates the config with default keys if they aren’t present

ctqa.confutil.createConfig(path)[source]¶

Creates JSON config file with the specified name and path. Defaults to the name config.json and stores at root.

ctqa.confutil.loadConfig(path)[source]¶

Attempts to load json config named/specced from path

Returns the JSON config or -1 (Bad validation)

ctqa.confutil.openConfig(path)[source]¶

Attempts to open the file at the passed path. Returns a dict object if found and parsed successfully.

Catches errors for FileNotFound (returns 0) and JSONDecodeError (returns -1).

ctqa.confutil.saveConfig(path, config)[source]¶

Attempts to save the passed config at the passed path.

Returns 1 on success and -1 on a FileNotFound error.

ctqa.confutil.updateConfig(path, key, value)[source]¶

Updates a config file at the passed path with the specified key : value pair.

Returns 1 on success and -1 on failure (Key doesn’t exist or was unable to save file). All errors are logged.

ctqa.confutil.validateConfig(conf)[source]¶

Attempts to validate passed dictionary object according to config standards.

ctqa.datautil module¶

Data Utility

Handles the saving and loading of CT QA data (audit results).

ctqa.datautil.load(folderpath)[source]¶

Loads CT QA data from the file on the passed path.

Returns -1 if JSON data is malformed.

ctqa.datautil.save(DATA, savelocation)[source]¶

Saves all site’s data from a dict object to the passed location

Returns -1 if JSON data is malformed.

ctqa.firstrun module¶

First Run Module

Contains logic for aiding in a user’s first run of the CTQA application.

ctqa.firstrun.run()[source]¶

The function run on the CTQA applications first run.

The user is asked if they want to run through a guided setup. If they agree, they are taken through filling out the configuration and profile values. At the end, the regular CTQA application GUI is started and shown.

ctqa.imgfetch module¶

Image Fetcher

Module for selecting/loading images from the appropriate source/module.

ctqa.imgfetch.getAllImages(conf)[source]¶

Gets a list of all image paths from the image source. The source is based off of the value from passed config.

Returns -1 if the source is bad.

ctqa.imgfetch.getImages(conf)[source]¶

Based off of the Source attribute in passed config, an image source is used to fetch a list of new image paths.

Returns -1 if the source is bad.

ctqa.imgfetch.getSizeOfImages(conf)[source]¶

Gets the size of all images from images source based off of the passed configuration.

Returns -1 if the source is bad.

ctqa.imgfetch.getTestImgs()[source]¶

Gets application test image paths.

ctqa.imgfetch.resource_path(relative_path)[source]¶

Fetches application resource paths.

ctqa.logutil module¶

CTQA Logging Utility

Utility for creating/instantiating a logger.

ctqa.logutil.initLog(fileName, logName, debug)[source]¶

Initializes the logger and returns the logger object.

ctqa.profileutil module¶

CTQA Config Utility

Utility for creating/saving/loading/updating a JSON configuration file.

ctqa.profileutil.get(path, key)[source]¶

Gets the value from the passed key on the passed path

ctqa.profileutil.getDefaultProfile()[source]¶

Returns a deep copy of the default profile.

ctqa.profileutil.getProfileName(profile)[source]¶

Assembles the profile ID based off of the profile keys.

Returns -1 if one of the keys isn’t present.

ctqa.profileutil.init(path)[source]¶

Initializes the profiles file to an empty JSON object and saves it.

ctqa.profileutil.keys(path)[source]¶

Returns a list of keys present in the top level of the profiles file.

Returns -1 if the loaded profiles object isn’t dict type.

ctqa.profileutil.newProfile(path, readerid, statname, manfct, manfctname, instname)[source]¶

Creates a dict object from the DEFAULT_PROFILE dict object. This new dict object is filled out with the passed values and returned.

If saving or opening the profiles file fails, a -1 is returned.

ctqa.profileutil.numKeys(path)[source]¶

Returns the number of keys present in the top level of the profiles file.

Returns -1 if the loaded profiles object isn’t dict type.

ctqa.profileutil.openProfiles(path)[source]¶

Attempts to open the profiles file at the passed location.

If a FileNotFound or JSONDecodeError is encountered, -1 is returned.

ctqa.profileutil.removeProfile(path, key)[source]¶

Removes profile and returns the values/None. Returns -1 in the event of failure.

ctqa.profileutil.saveProfiles(path, profiles)[source]¶

Attempts to save the passed profiles dict object to the passed path.

If a FileNotFound error is encountered, -1 is returned.

ctqa.profileutil.validProfile(profile)[source]¶

Checks a profile for valid values in the present keys.

ctqa.reportutil module¶

Report Utility

Generates and saves a CT machine’s report based off of audit data.

ctqa.reportutil.generateReport(dataPath, config, title, upperlimit, lowerlimit, report_type='daily')[source]¶

Retrieves audit data from the data path, organizes a site’s data into a displayable format, and creates a PNG graph at the passed save location.

ctqa.reportutil.regenerateReports(dataPath, config, profiles, report_type='daily')[source]¶

Finds all data folders and updates reports based on existing data

ctqa.servicemanager module¶

Service Manager

Detects the OS and installs the CTQA service to run the audit on a regular basis.

ctqa.servicemanager.install()[source]¶

Detects the OS and runs the appropriate installation method.

ctqa.servicemanager.install_windows()[source]¶

Attempts to install the CTQA Audit utility as a task in Windows Task Scheduler.

ctqa.servicemanager.uninstall()[source]¶

Detects the OS and runs the appropriate uninstallation method.

ctqa.servicemanager.uninstall_windows()[source]¶

Attempts to uninstall the CTQA Audit task with the Schtasks command
